work even slip_stitch to join and bind off leaving an 8 long tail to 9 17 sew the leg to the body later on do not stuff the rest of the leg weave a strand of orange yarn around jack s waistband to form a sort of belt tie off and tuck in ends page 4 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com stem row instruction stitches 1 using brown 4 chain 2 4 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 working in blo work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 4 3 work even 4 4 work even bind off and leave a tail stuff the stem using a pencil to 4 get the stuffing into the stem using the cast on and bind off tails weave one tail through the center top of jack s head see picture below tie a good knot and tuck the end inside page 5 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together all of jack s pieces waiting to be put together sewing head and body together since you ended with 18 stitches at the head and the body the pieces should fit together perfectly stem placement page 6 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head stem and body in place i like to put the legs on next sew each leg between row 4 & 5 from center bottom arms go just below the neck line at shoulder height page 7 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com i like to use 2 strands of a 4 ply yarn to do the faces but you could use embroidery thread it was hard to make triangle eyes… lastly thread some orange yarn through your yarn needle and give him a belt i weaved it through every other stitch and he s all done page 8 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
